p: Disentangling molecular interactions underlying cancer properties may help in understanding and predicting cancer behaviour, selecting therapeutic targets and efficacious drugs to be employed for treatments. In this, gene co-expression networks and, even more, differential co-expression networks have shown a strong potential. A wealth of different methods has been developed ( Table 2, Table 3, Table 4 and Table 5), allowing for pinpointing gene relationships specific to cancer or to precise cancer types/stages.
